item.title: Basic model of an MDP
item.description: Markov decision processes (MDP) are the simplest model of a stochastic control system. The dynamic behavior of an MDP is modeled by an equation of the form \[ X_{t+1} = f_t(X_t, U_t, W_t) \] where \(X_t \in \ALPHABET X\) is the state, \(U_t \in \ALPHABET U\) is the control input, and \(W_t \in \ALPHABET W\) is the noise. An agent/controller observes the state and chooses the control input \(U_t\). The controller can be as sophisticated as we want.
